com.terradue.ogf.saga.impl.job
Class JobFactory

java.lang.Object
  org.ogf.saga.job.JobFactory
      com.terradue.ogf.saga.impl.job.JobFactory

public abstract class JobFactory
extends org.ogf.saga.job.JobFactory

Factory for objects from the job package. This class wraps the original implementation of JobFactory and implements some extensions transparently with JavaSAGA API. In fact, the JavaSAGA original implementation is still used and simply called implementation. When the documentation refers to extension, it means the additional implementation of the extension. For instance, createJobService() enables the creation of the extension JobServiceImpl with the information on the resources.

Author:
emathot

Creates an empty job description.

Returns:
the job description.
Throws:
org.ogf.saga.error.NotImplementedException - is thrown when this method is not implemented.
org.ogf.saga.error.NoSuccessException - is thrown when the Saga factory could not be created.

createJobDescription

public static org.ogf.saga.job.JobDescription createJobDescription(JSDLDocument jsdl)
                                                            throws org.ogf.saga.error.BadParameterException,
                                                                   org.ogf.saga.error.NoSuccessException,
                                                                   org.ogf.saga.error.NotImplementedException,
                                                                   org.ogf.saga.error.AuthenticationFailedException,
                                                                   org.ogf.saga.error.AuthorizationFailedException,
                                                                   org.ogf.saga.error.PermissionDeniedException,
                                                                   org.ogf.saga.error.IncorrectStateException,
                                                                   org.ogf.saga.error.DoesNotExistException,
                                                                   org.ogf.saga.error.TimeoutException
Creates a job description from a JSDLDocument processing template. The mapping is done according to the SSEGrid-T2-D2420-3 Grid Infrastructure ICD - section 8.1.4

Returns:
the job description filled with element of JSDLDocument.
Throws:
org.ogf.saga.error.BadParameterException - is thrown if the JSDL Document is null.
org.ogf.saga.error.NoSuccessException - is thrown when the Saga factory could not be created.
org.ogf.saga.error.NotImplementedException - - is thrown if the implementation does not provide an implementation of this method.
org.ogf.saga.error.AuthenticationFailedException - - is thrown when operation failed because none of the available session contexts could successfully be used for authentication.
org.ogf.saga.error.AuthorizationFailedException - - is thrown when none of the available contexts of the used session could be used for successful authorization. This error indicates that the resource could not be accessed at all, and not that an operation was not available due to restricted permissions.
org.ogf.saga.error.PermissionDeniedException - - is thrown when the method failed because the identity used did not have sufficient permissions to perform the operation successfully.
org.ogf.saga.error.IncorrectStateException - - is thrown when the attribute is not a vector attribute.
org.ogf.saga.error.BadParameterException - - is thrown when the specified value does not conform to the attribute type. In particular, this exception is thrown when the specified value is null. An array with no elements is allowed, though.
org.ogf.saga.error.DoesNotExistException - - is thrown when the attribute does not exist.
org.ogf.saga.error.TimeoutException - - is thrown when a remote operation did not complete successfully because the network communication or the remote service timed out.
org.ogf.saga.error.NoSuccessException - - is thrown when the Saga factory could not be created or the operation was not successfully performed, and none of the other exceptions apply.

createJobService

public static JobServiceImpl createJobService(org.ogf.saga.session.Session session,
                                              org.ogf.saga.url.URL rm)
                                       throws org.ogf.saga.error.NotImplementedException,
                                              org.ogf.saga.error.BadParameterException,
                                              org.ogf.saga.error.IncorrectURLException,
                                              org.ogf.saga.error.AuthenticationFailedException,
                                              org.ogf.saga.error.AuthorizationFailedException,
                                              org.ogf.saga.error.PermissionDeniedException,
                                              org.ogf.saga.error.TimeoutException,
                                              org.ogf.saga.error.NoSuccessException
Creates a job service.

Parameters:
session - the session handle.
rm - contact string for the resource manager. If the contact string returns a GLUE schema, the operation is extended to read resource information according to the GLUE specification according to the SSEGrid-T2-D2420-3 Grid Infrastructure ICD - section 7.1.2
Returns:
the job service.
Throws:
org.ogf.saga.error.NotImplementedException - is thrown if the implementation does not provide an implementation of this method.
org.ogf.saga.error.PermissionDeniedException - is thrown when the method failed because the identity used did not have sufficient permissions to perform the operation successfully.
org.ogf.saga.error.AuthorizationFailedException - is thrown when none of the available contexts of the used session could be used for successful authorization. This error indicates that the resource could not be accessed at all, and not that an operation was not available due to restricted permissions.
org.ogf.saga.error.AuthenticationFailedException - is thrown when operation failed because none of the available session contexts could successfully be used for authentication.
org.ogf.saga.error.TimeoutException - is thrown when a remote operation did not complete successfully because the network communication or the remote service timed out.
org.ogf.saga.error.IncorrectURLException - is thrown when an implementation cannot handle the specified protocol, or that access to the specified entity via the given protocol is impossible.
org.ogf.saga.error.BadParameterException - is thrown if the specified URL cannot be contacted, or a default contact point does not exist or cannot be found.
org.ogf.saga.error.NoSuccessException - is thrown when the operation was not successfully performed, and none of the other exceptions apply.
ResourceException
MissingConfigurationException - is thrown if a parameter is null
